tags.name: paper-avatar
tags.description:
`paper-avatar`
User avatar in material style

### Styling

To change the background color:

    paper-avatar {
      --paper-avatar-color: red;
    }

To change the size of the avatar:

    paper-avatar {
      --paper-avatar-width: 60px;
    }

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-avatar-width` | Size (width and height) of the avatar image | `40px`
`--paper-avatar-color` | Background color of the avatar image |

Attributes:

  * `colors` {`any[]`} - Array of colors for avatar background

  * `label` {`string`} - Label with username

  * `src` {`string`} - Image address or base64

  * `jdenticonExists` {`boolean`} - Ensure we can support jdenticon before invoking it

  * `two-chars` {`boolean`} - Show two chars in avatar

  * `jdenticon` {`boolean`} - Set true if you want use a jdenticon avatar

Properties:

  * `colors` {`any[]`} - Array of colors for avatar background

  * `label` {`string`} - Label with username

  * `src` {`string`} - Image address or base64

  * `jdenticonExists` {`boolean`} - Ensure we can support jdenticon before invoking it

  * `twoChars` {`boolean`} - Show two chars in avatar

  * `jdenticon` {`boolean`} - Set true if you want use a jdenticon avatar

attributes.name: colors
attributes.description:
`colors` {`any[]`} - Array of colors for avatar background

Property: colors

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
`label` {`string`} - Label with username

Property: label

Default: null

`src` {`string`} - Image address or base64

Property: src

Default: null

attributes.description:
`jdenticonExists` {`boolean`} - Ensure we can support jdenticon before invoking it

Property: jdenticonExists

Default: false

attributes.name: two-chars
attributes.description:
`two-chars` {`boolean`} - Show two chars in avatar

Property: twoChars

Default: false

attributes.name: jdenticon
attributes.description:
`jdenticon` {`boolean`} - Set true if you want use a jdenticon avatar

Property: jdenticon

Default: false
